hints.content: The mass of the walrus in May is $\greenD{850}$ kilograms.
The walrus weighed $\purpleD{63}$ kilograms less in June than he did in May.

We can find the mass of the walrus in June by subtracting the weight the walrus lost $(\purpleD{63}\text { kg})$ from the mass of the walrus in May $(\greenD{850}\text{ kg})$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled 850 kilograms. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Weight in May. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The shorter left part is labeled 63 kilograms. The longer right part is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the shorter left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Weight lost. A curved bracket across the longer right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Weight in June. !

hints.content: The walrus weighed $787$ kilograms in June.

question.content:
A walrus at the aquarium is weighed once a month. His weight for May is shown below.

[[☃ image 1]]

In June, the walrus weighed $63$ kilograms less than he did in May.

**What did the walrus weigh in June? **  

[[☃ input-number 1]] kilograms

options.alt: A hanging scale weighing a walrus with a starting major tick mark of 0 kilograms and the additional 9 major tick marks labeled 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, and 900. There is 1 minor unlabeled tick mark between every 2 major tick marks. The mass of the walrus on the scale is at the minor unlabeled tick mark after the major tick mark labeled 800. !
